titleStmt.title: A pleasant new ballad of the Miller of Mansfield in Sherwood and how he was lodged at a millers house, and their pleasant communication. To the tune of, The French lavalto.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, and J. Wright,

notesStmt.note: Right half of sheet contains: The Second Part of the Miller and the King, shewing how he came to Court with his wife & son, and what merry conceits passed between the King and him.
Reproduction of original in: William Andrews Clark Memorial Library, University of California, Los Angeles.
